Article Title: Australia suffer big blow: Josh Hazlewood out of Ashes, Pat Cummins back for Adelaide Test
Article Text:
Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood bowl during a practice session. (Getty Images)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Tom Kohler-Cadmore: ‘If I Middle It, It’s probably a six!’ | Power-Hitting Mindset Explained

Poll How significant do you think Josh Hazlewood's absence will be for Australia in the Ashes series? Very significant Somewhat significant Not very significant

Australia have been handed a major setback in their bid to dominate the Ashes series, with pace spearhead Josh Hazlewood ruled out of the remainder of the contest against England. The unfortunate blow coincides with the crucial return of Pat Cummins, who is expected to reclaim the captaincy for next week’s third Test in Adelaide.Head coach Andrew McDonald confirmed on Tuesday that Hazlewood’s prolonged recovery from a hamstring strain had been complicated by a fresh Achilles issue. The 34-year-old had already missed the opening two Tests and will now shift focus toward being fully fit for the T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka in February.“Really flat for him. A couple of setbacks that we didn’t see coming,” McDonald said. “We thought he’d play a huge part in the series. But really feel for him that he won’t get that opportunity.”Hazlewood’s absence leaves Australia with a fast-bowling puzzle to solve just as Cummins looks set to strengthen both the attack and leadership. The 32-year-old has not played since July’s tour of the Caribbean due to a lower-back injury but impressed during intense match-simulation workloads at Allan Border Field last week.“This is something we’ve done with Pat before with long-ish layoffs,” McDonald explained. “He simulated pretty much what a match will look like with multiple spells. We feel as though he’ll be as best prepared as can be.”Cummins’ readiness almost pushed him into the Brisbane Test, as selectors debated lifting overs restrictions after rapid recovery progress. However, with the captain returning now, Australia’s pace plans gain a fresh outlook, especially with tight scheduling between the final three Tests.There was more positive news with left-arm quick Mitchell Starc cleared to play in Adelaide despite battling a side niggle during the Brisbane Test. Starc has been in exceptional form, leading the wicket charts with 18 scalps in two matches.Australia are still expected to rotate their pace options, with Scott Boland, Michael Neser, Jhye Richardson and Brendon Doggett all under consideration to share workloads over the packed schedule.While Cummins’ comeback bolsters Australian confidence, Hazlewood’s exit leaves a void that may test squad depth under high pressure. The Adelaide Test now looms not just as a chance to clinch the series, but as a trial of Australia’s adaptability without one of their most experienced strike weapons.
Article Summary: Australia have been handed a major setback in their bid to dominate the Ashes. Josh Hazlewood has been ruled out of the remainder of the contest against England. The unfortunate blow coincides with the crucial return of Pat Cummins. Cummins is expected to reclaim the captaincy for next week’s third Test in Adelaide.

Article Title: ILT20: Desert Vipers edge Gulf Giants in Super Over thriller
Article Text:
The result continued the Vipers’ dominance over the Giants, marking their sixth successive win against them. (Image credit: ILT20)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Shimron Hetmyer interview: Opens up on hitting sixes, playing T20 leagues and ILT20 experience

The Desert Vipers held their nerve to secure a dramatic victory in the first-ever Super Over in ILT20 history, defeating the Gulf Giants at the Dubai International Stadium. Chasing 180, Sam Curran (44 off 36) and Dan Lawrence (56 off 31) guided the Vipers to level the score, taking the game into a Super Over. The result continued the Vipers’ dominance over the Giants, marking their sixth successive win against them.Despite Azmatullah Omarzai’s impressive four-wicket haul for the Giants, the effort fell short as the Vipers’ lower order contributed valuable runs to keep their chase alive and stretch the match into a thrilling finish.Earlier, the Gulf Giants got off to a flying start. Pathum Nissanka (56 off 29) and Rahmanullah Gurbaz (41 off 31) hammered 14 runs off Naseem Shah in the first over. The duo put up a brisk 50 partnership inside five overs and powered the innings to 58 by the end of the powerplay.Nissanka continued his strong tournament form, bringing up his third straight half-century off just 27 deliveries. He struck Noor Ahmad for his fourth six, but the spinner struck back immediately to send him back, ending a 73-run opening stand.Gurbaz kept the momentum going with support from James Vince, who contributed 25 off 22 balls.Their 54-run partnership was broken by Khuzaima Tanveer, who dismissed Vince and removed Gurbaz shortly after. By the 14th over, the Giants were placed comfortably at 129/3.The Vipers bowlers tightened things in the death overs. Noor picked up his second wicket, sending back Omarzai (20 off 13), while David Payne removed Moeen Ali (11 off 11). The Giants could only add 38 runs in the final five overs, finishing at 179/5.In response, Omarzai and Mark Adair rattled the Vipers early, reducing them to 14/2. Curran and Max Holden (15 off 15) attempted to rebuild, but wickets continued to fall as Haider Razzaq and Nuwan Thushara kept the pressure on. Curran and Lawrence revived hopes with a 60-run stand, before Omarzai’s double strike shifted momentum again.With 13 needed off the last over, Tanveer struck a six before being caught brilliantly by Gurbaz. Vriitya Aravind then held his composure to tie the game and force the Super Over.The Vipers posted 13 in the tiebreaker, and Naseem Shah successfully defended it by restricting the Giants to nine.Reflecting on the win, Sam Curran said, “It has been the trend recently, but I am not complaining — three wins from three.” He also praised Tanveer, adding, “Tanveer has been working extremely hard on his batting in the nets. To hit a six under pressure and then bowl really well are very positive signs.”Gulf Giants skipper Moeen Ali admitted his side missed key moments, saying, “We made a couple of mistakes at the wrong time and allowed them back into the game. When we needed a few good balls, we gave them something to hit. In this format, the game is never over, and it was one we could easily have won.”
Article Summary: The Desert Vipers held their nerve to secure a dramatic victory in the first- ever Super Over in ILT20 history, defeating the Gulf Giants at the Dubai International Stadium. Chasing 180, Sam Curran (44 off 36) and Dan Lawrence (56 off 31) guided the Vipers to level the score, taking the game into a Super Over. The result continued the Viper’s dominance over the Giants, marking their sixth successive win against them.

Article Title: ISPL Season 3: When is the player auction - date, time, venue, live streaming

The Indian Street Premier League (ISPL) has announced its Season 3 player auction , set for December 9 in Mumbai. A total of 408 players from 101 cities will participate in the auction, where eight teams will compete with an increased purse of Rs 1.5 crore to build their squads for the tennis-ball T10 tournament scheduled from January 9 to February 6, 2026, at the Lalbhai Contractor Stadium in Surat.The auction pool includes 400 shortlisted players, with 30 under-19 talents, plus eight scout picks chosen by each team. Players will enter with a base price of Rs 3 lakh and will be categorised into six zones: U-19, West, East, Central, South, and North. Teams can now have larger squads of 18 players, up from the previous limit of 16.A new exciting feature called "Googly Power" has been introduced, allowing teams to suddenly increase bids by Rs 1 lakh during intense bidding battles. Teams will have two RTM (Right to Match) cards, giving them the chance to retain their previous players by matching the highest bid.The league has set strict squad requirements. Teams must pick at least two players from each zone and two U-19 players. Every match must include one U-19 player and one player from each zone in the playing XI. To ensure fair play, all 18 squad members must play at least one match during the season.Two new teams have joined the league this season - Delhi Superheros owned by Salman Khan and Ahmedabad Lions owned by Ajay Devgn. They will compete alongside existing teams including defending champions Majhi Mumbai (Amitabh Bachchan), Tiigers of Kolkata (Saif Ali Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan), Srinagar Ke Veer (Akshay Kumar), Chennai Singams (Suriya), Bengaluru Strikers (Hrithik Roshan), and Falcon Risers Hyderabad (Ram Charan).The league has also announced an attractive incentive - the season's Most Valuable Player will win a Porsche 911.The tournament is backed by prominent figures including Sachin Tendulkar , Ashish Shelar, Minal Amol Kale, and Suraj Samat, who form the Core Committee Members driving the league's growth and success.The ISPL Auction will take place on December 9, 2025.The ISPL Auction will take place in Mumbai.The ISPL Auction will be broadcast live on Star Sports Network (on TV) and JioStar (on streaming).
Article Summary: The Indian Street Premier League (ISPL) has announced its Season 3 player auction, set for December 9 in Mumbai. A total of 408 players from 101 cities will participate in the auction, where eight teams will compete with an increased purse of Rs 1.5 crore. The auction pool includes 400 shortlisted players, with 30 under-19 talents, plus eight scout picks chosen by each team.

Article Title: Mitchell Marsh likely done with first-class cricket; questions rise over Australia Test career
Article Text:
Mitchell Marsh (Photo by Josh Chadwick/Getty Images)

Tom Kohler-Cadmore: ‘If I Middle It, It’s probably a six!’ | Power-Hitting Mindset Explained

Mitchell Marsh is likely ending his first-class cricket career with Western Australia, raising questions about his Test future, according to The Sydney Morning Herald.The 34-year-old informed his WA teammates after Sunday's Sheffield Shield match against Victoria about his plans to step away from state-level red-ball cricket . While he plans to officially retire at the season's end, he is not expected to play any more first-class matches for WA.Marsh has played nine Sheffield Shield matches for his state since 2019. In his recent Melbourne game, where he was considered for the Ashes, he scored just 9 and 4. The all-rounder, who started his WA career against NSW in 2009, has indicated to teammates he remains open to Test cricket if selected.His potential Test selection without Shield cricket participation presents challenges. Australia has no remaining Shield fixtures this year, and Marsh will be occupied with the national T20 team before the T20 World Cup when domestic red-ball cricket resumes."We would be comfortable picking someone, and if you want to put a name to it, Mitch (Mitchell) Marsh, out of white-ball cricket if we felt like that was going to benefit the Test team," Australia coach Andrew McDonald said in October, as quoted from The Sydney Morning Herald."He's the captain of the white-ball team. It's very hard for him to vacate and balance out Test preparation, if he was to be in the window for that," McDonald added."We still haven't given up on Mitch Marsh's Test career."Marsh, who has faced multiple injuries, seems to be accepting that his Test career might be over.Since his 2014 debut, he has played 46 Tests, with his last appearance against India in Melbourne in 2024. Beau Webster replaced him for the Sydney Test this year.His last red-ball cricket experience was during the 2024 Border-Gavaskar Trophy, where he managed only one double-digit score of 47. This followed his successful 2023 Ashes comeback featuring a memorable century. However, 2025 proved difficult with 283 runs in 15 innings, averaging 18.60 across nine Tests.His overall Test career includes 2,083 runs in 80 innings at 28.53, with three centuries and nine fifties. His highest score is 181, along with 51 wickets at 40.41. His unbeaten 118 at Headingley in the 2023 Ashes remains his career highlight.Australia's next Test match after this summer's Ashes will be against Bangladesh in August next year.In his first-class career spanning 122 matches, Marsh has scored 6,415 runs, including 13 hundreds and 29 fifties, while taking 171 wickets.
Article Summary: Mitchell Marsh is likely ending his first-class cricket career with Western Australia. The 34-year-old informed his WA teammates after Sunday's Sheffield Shield match against Victoria about his plans to step away from state-level red- ball cricket. He has played nine Sheffield Shield matches for his state since 2019.

Article Title: Shocking! 'We gave Sanju opportunities': Samson to get dropped from the playing XI again?
Article Text:
Sanju Samson of India (Photo by Francois Nel/Getty Images)

Suryakumar Yadav Press Conference: on Sanju, Dube & India’s T20 Gameplan for South Africa

India’s T20I setup is set for a shake-up as Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya return to the squad ahead of the five-match series against South Africa starting Tuesday at Cuttack. Their inclusion raises immediate questions about the middle order, particularly the role of Sanju Samson , who has seen his position shift in recent months.Samson had been India’s go-to opener last year, forming a productive partnership with Abhishek Sharma . However, with Gill promoted to vice-captain, Samson was moved down the order during the Asia Cup. He has been in fine touch in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, scoring 51, 43, 46, and 73, but captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed the order will remain unchanged, with Gill opening and Samson in the middle.“Sanju did really well when he opened the innings, but Shubman had played before him in the Sri Lanka series, so he deserves to take that spot,” Suryakumar said ahead of the series opener.Adding more competition, Jitesh Sharma is pushing for a spot in the middle order. In India’s last T20I against Australia, Jitesh replaced Samson as wicketkeeper-batter and scored an unbeaten 22 to help India level the series 1-1. His performance puts Samson under direct scrutiny and creates a healthy contest for spots.“We gave Sanju opportunities. He is flexible to bat anywhere from No. 3 to 6, and both [Samson and Jitesh] can play multiple roles.That’s an asset and a good headache for us,” Suryakumar added.The good news for India is that both Gill and Hardik Pandya are fully fit. Hardik missed the Asia Cup final due to a quadriceps injury but returned to action with Baroda in the SMAT, while Gill has recovered from a neck injury sustained in the first Test against South Africa.“Both are looking healthy and fit. Hardik’s return opens up options with the playing XI. Their experience in big games and ICC events will give the side a good balance,” Suryakumar said, signalling that India now has both firepower and flexibility heading into the T20 series.
Article Summary: India's T20I setup is set for a shake-up as Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya return to the squad ahead of the five-match series against South Africa. Their inclusion raises immediate questions about the middle order, particularly the role of Sanju Samson, who has seen his position shift in recent months.

Article Title: Ashes: 'I'm not a selector but I will say ...' - Australia batter drops selection updates ahead of crucial 3rd Test against England
Article Text:
Australia's captain Steve Smith, left, and Marnus Labuschagne (AP Photo/Gary Day)

Suryakumar Yadav Press Conference: on Sanju, Dube & India’s T20 Gameplan for South Africa

Australia face selection decisions ahead of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide as they aim to secure the series against England.Their commanding 2-0 lead came after an eight-wicket victory in Brisbane on Sunday, with more than a week's break before the next ICC World Test Championship match at Adelaide Oval on December 17.Team captain Pat Cummins is expected to return to the playing eleven. The team management will assess the fitness of opener Usman Khawaja and fast bowler Josh Hazlewood before the upcoming match.The Australian team might consider bringing back experienced spinner Nathan Lyon, who was left out of the Brisbane day-night Test. Marnus Labuschagne has indicated that selectors will prioritise team balance based on Adelaide's conditions."I'm not a selector, but what I will say is the same way they (selectors) looked at this game, they looked at the game objectively and said what was the best way for us to win this game with all the information we have on pink-ball cricket," Labuschagne said, as quoted by the official ICC website."What plays, what favours it's been (in past Tests). Is it pace or whatever that is or what type of bowler? And then they make the decision."The potential return of Cummins, Hazlewood, and Lyon could mean disappointment for some players. Michael Neser, Scott Boland, and Brendan Doggett impressed during the Gabba victory.Neser's performance was particularly noteworthy, claiming five wickets in England's second innings. This achievement didn't surprise Labuschagne."To see him take five wickets with an old ball...it was awesome," he added. "There was a moment earlier in the season where I was just like, 'Man, I hope he gets his chance.'""I saw the writing on the wall there that there's potential and for him to be able to come in and deliver I think there was little bit of nerves that first innings and then to come out second innings and play that role, get a five-for, I was just so happy."He just keeps delivering and delivering and we didn't see the best of his batting either and I think that's probably the exciting part as well is he's got a lot to offer with not only the ball but that (batting) and his fielding."Labuschagne has shown consistency in the first two Ashes Tests. He scored 128 runs with two half-centuries in four innings, ranking as the third-highest run-scorer across both teams.He credited Australia's new opening pair, Jake Weatherald and Travis Head, for easing his role at number three. He also attributed his success to his ability to adapt to different conditions early in his innings."I pride myself on being able to read the conditions and play what's in front of me and what is necessary at certain times. It's been nice to come off the back of momentum and be able to put the bowlers under pressure from the start of my innings."I've really enjoyed that but, you know, it's once again, it's each game on its own, trying to read the conditions and read what the team needs."
Article Summary: Australia face selection decisions ahead of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide. Marnus Labuschagne has indicated that selectors will prioritise team balance based on Adelaide's conditions. Michael Neser, Scott Boland, and Brendan Doggett impressed during the Gabba victory.

Article Title: Premier League: Crystal Palace soar into top four; Brighton deny West Ham with dramatic late twist
Article Text:
Marc Guehi of Crystal Palace celebrates scoring his team's second goal. (Getty Images)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Exclusive: Vidit Gujrathi Opens Up on 'Big' Burnout and Friendship with GM Anish Giri

Poll Do you think Crystal Palace will qualify for the Champions League this season? Yes No

Crystal Palace’s stunning Premier League surge continued on Sunday as they climbed into fourth place with a 2-1 win over Fulham, while Brighton struck in stoppage-time to deny West Ham a vital escape from the relegation zone in a 1-1 draw.At Craven Cottage, Marc Guehi was the hero for Palace, powering home an 87th-minute header that sealed their fourth win in six league outings. The late strike pushed Oliver Glasner’s side above Chelsea and Everton, strengthening what has now become a genuine bid for Champions League qualification.It marks yet another milestone in a remarkable period for the formerly unfancied south London club, who have already celebrated a shock FA Cup triumph over Manchester City last season and lifted the Community Shield against Liverpool earlier this term. They are also pushing through the UEFA Conference League group phase and could soon be preparing for a dream European upgrade.Palace struck first in the 20th minute when Adam Wharton’s smart through ball found Eddie Nketiah, who drilled home past Bernd Leno. Fulham levelled in the 38th minute through Harry Wilson’s stunning outside-of-the-boot finish. Emile Smith Rowe briefly thought he had completed the comeback, but his close-range effort was ruled out after VAR spotted a marginal offside by Samuel Chukwueze.Palace punished that reprieve with Guehi’s decisive finish from a corner.“It makes me proud because the team did not want to defend the draw, we wanted to win and that’s why we got it,” Glasner said, hailing his side’s belief and resilience.Meanwhile, at the Amex Stadium, West Ham were seconds from climbing out of the relegation zone after Jarrod Bowen fired them ahead in the 73rd minute. But Georginio Rutter’s scrappy stoppage-time effort rescued a point for seventh-placed Brighton, keeping them in the European chase while leaving West Ham in 18th place.Manager Nuno Espirito Santo was furious after VAR allowed the equaliser to stand. “It’s hard to take,” Nuno said. “Everybody saw it. We cannot understand how they gave the goal.” Despite the frustration, West Ham’s improved form — one defeat in six — continues to fuel hope for survival.
Article Summary: Crystal Palace moved into fourth place with a 2-1 win over Fulham. Marc Guehi's 87th-minute header sealed their fourth win in six league games. West Ham were seconds from climbing out of the relegation zone after Jarrod Bowen fired them ahead in the 73rd minute. Georginio Rutter’s scrappy stoppage-time effort rescued a point for seventh-placed Brighton.

Article Title: Mo’ problems: Salah says club has 'thrown me under the bus'; hints at Liverpool exit
Article Text:
Mohamed Salah of Liverpool during the Premier League match between Liverpool and Sunderland at Anfield on December 03, 2025 in Liverpool, England. (Photo/Getty Images)

Liverpool coach Arne Slot was still processing Liverpool’s latest setback at Leeds when Mohamed Salah criticised him and the club’s management in a post-match interaction, raising questions about whether his time at Anfield (home ground of Liverpool FC) is coming to an end.Liverpool, the Premier League champions, are dealing with a poor run of four wins in 15 matches across competitions and now face the possibility of a difficult split with one of their most successful players.Only Ian Rush and Roger Hunt have scored more goals for the club than Salah, who has 250. The forward contributed to two league titles, including last season, when he won multiple individual awards as Slot secured the league in his first year.Salah has now said his relationship with Slot has broken down after being kept on the bench for three straight matches."I'm very, very disappointed to be fair. I have done so much for this club down the years and especially last season," Salah told media. "Now I'm sitting on the bench and I don't know why. It seems like the club has thrown me under the bus. That is how I am feeling. I think it is very clear that someone wanted me to get all of the blame."Slot had backed Salah through the season despite the 33-year-old struggling for form. Salah has scored five goals in 19 games and has been criticised by pundits for not contributing defensively.Salah and Liverpool were already preparing for a temporary break, with the player set to join Egypt for the Africa Cup of Nations after fixtures against Inter Milan and Brighton this week.Salah suggested the Brighton match could be his last at Anfield."I’m going to enjoy that game because I don’t know what is going to happen now," he said."I will be at Anfield to say goodbye to the fans and go to the Africa cup. I don't know what is going to happen when I am there."Liverpool’s inability to hold 2-0 and 3-2 leads against Leeds left them with only two wins from their last 10 league games, dropping to eighth place and ending their hopes of retaining the title.
Article Summary: Mohamed Salah says his relationship with Liverpool coach Arne Slot has broken down. Salah has been kept on the bench for three straight matches. Liverpool are on a poor run of four wins in 15 matches across competitions. Liverpool's inability to hold 2-0 and 3-2 leads against Leeds left them with two wins from their last 10 league games.

Article Title: Ferran Torres nets hat trick as Barcelona beat Betis in La Liga
Article Text:

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Saurabh Netravalkar Interview: Gets emotional about playing at Wankhede, for USA; ILT20 and more

Ferran Torres netted a hat-trick, Lamine Yamal scored from the penalty spot, and Roony Bardghji impressed in a rare start as Barcelona stormed back to beat Real Betis 5-3 in La Liga on Saturday. The victory over fifth-placed Betis in Seville stretched Barcelona’s lead to four points over Real Madrid ahead of their home match against Celta Vigo on Sunday.Once a rotation option, Torres has evolved into Hansi Flick’s first-choice striker. The Spain forward now has more starts than Robert Lewandowski, whose playing time at 37 is being managed carefully. Torres leads Barcelona’s scoring charts with 13 goals — 11 in La Liga — trailing only Real Madrid’s Kylian Mbappé, who has 16 in the league.Bardghji made the most of his third start since joining from Copenhagen in the summer. The 20-year-old Sweden winger dazzled with sharp dribbling and provided the assist for Torres’ go-ahead goal before smashing home Barcelona’s third from just inside the box.Lewandowski and Raphinha stayed on the bench, leaving both fresh for Tuesday’s Champions League clash against Eintracht Frankfurt.Betis took the lead early through Anthony in the sixth minute, but Barcelona replied almost instantly.Torres slipped in behind the defence to tap in a pass from Jules Koundé, then added another just two minutes later with a spectacular volley from Bardghji’s cross. Bardghji’s strike in the 31st minute made it 3-1, before Torres completed his hat-trick 40 minutes in with a deflected effort.In a tactical shift, Yamal played centrally rather than in his usual right-wing role. The teenager linked well in midfield and helped create the first goal before calmly converting a penalty in the 59th minute after Marcus Rashford’s effort struck the outstretched arm of Marc Bartra.Betis pulled goals back late through Diego Llorente and a Cucho Hernández penalty after Koundé fouled Abde. Rashford nearly added a sixth for Barcelona on a solo break but dragged his shot wide.Manuel Pellegrini’s Betis entered the match in strong form after beating rivals Sevilla and going eight games unbeaten. They could drop a place if Espanyol secure at least a draw against Rayo Vallecano on Sunday.Barcelona midfielder Fermín López returned as a second-half substitute after missing two matches with a leg injury.Tajon Buchanan and Georges Mikautadze scored as Villarreal beat Getafe 2-0 to stay third, one point behind Madrid.In the Basque derby, Alavés stunned Real Sociedad with a 1-0 win.
Article Summary: Ferran Torres scored a hat-trick as Barcelona beat Real Betis 5-3 in La Liga. Lamine Yamal, Roony Bardghji and Diego Llorente also scored for the Catalans. The victory stretched Barcelona's lead to four points over Real Madrid.

Article Title: Arsenal's Premier League title charge suffers massive dent as Aston Villa end their 18-match unbeaten run
Article Text:
Aston Villa vs Arsenal (Photo by Alex Pantling/Getty Images)

Arsenal's Premier League title hopes suffered a setback as Aston Villa secured a 2-1 victory with Emiliano Buendia's stoppage-time winner on Saturday. The result reduced Villa's gap to league leaders Arsenal to three points, while also providing Manchester City an opportunity to gain ground on Arsenal.In the final moments at Villa Park, Buendia found the back of the net in the fifth minute of added time, leaving Arsenal shell-shocked."In the manner that happened at the end, obviously, (it is) really difficult to take," Arteta told TNT Sports.Arsenal's third consecutive away game without a win, following draws with Sunderland and Chelsea, has allowed rivals City and Villa to increase pressure at the top of the table.Villa moved to second place temporarily after winning nine of their last ten matches. This turnaround came after a challenging start under Unai Emery, where they failed to win their first five games."At the minute we're on a great run," said Matty Cash, who scored Villa's opener in the 36th. "We know it's not even Christmas yet, so we have to keep being demanding, keep being consistent, and then we'll see where it takes us."Arsenal's substitute Leandro Trossard equalized seven minutes into the second half.Buendia, who entered the game in the 87th minute, proved to be a game-changing substitution by scoring past Arsenal goalkeeper David Raya."We fight until the last minute, the last second, it was a really incredible win," he said.This marked only Arsenal's second defeat of the season, their first since losing 1-0 to Liverpool in August."We were 18 games unbeaten, and yet still the margin is so small," Arteta said. "We have to focus on ourselves and set the standards that today, particularly, individually we didn't raise that level. The effort was absolutely there and use that pain to go again."
Article Summary: Aston Villa defeated Arsenal 2-1 in the Premier League on Saturday. Emiliano Buendia scored a stoppage-time winner for Villa. The result reduced Arsenal's gap to three points at the top of the table. Villa moved to second place temporarily after winning nine of their last ten matches.

Article Title: 'We have to come up with another name for the NFL': Donald Trump
Article Text:
US President Donald Trump and Gianni Infantino, the president of FIFA, participate in the draw for the 2026 FIFA World Cup at the Kennedy Center in Washington (AFP Photo)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Saurabh Netravalkar Interview: Gets emotional about playing at Wankhede, for USA; ILT20 and more

Riding the excitement of the 2026 FIFA World Cup, US President Donald Trump on Friday suggested that American football should be renamed, arguing that the game played with a round ball — soccer — is the sport that truly deserves the name "football.""We have a little bit of a conflict with another thing that's called football but when you think about it, shouldn't it really be called ... football, there is no question. We have to come up with another name for the NFL (National Football League)," Trump said at the World Cup draw."It really doesn't make sense when you think about it."In the United States, "football" refers to American football — a sport played largely with the hands and vastly different from the game the rest of the world knows as football.Every year, millions of Americans tune in to watch the NFL’s championship game, the Super Bowl. During the event, FIFA President Gianni Infantino reminded the US audience that the 2026 World Cup would be the equivalent of "104 Super Bowls."Trump, known for his interest in a variety of sports, has increasingly embraced soccer as the 2026 World Cup — set to be hosted by the United States, Mexico and Canada — draws closer.
Article Summary: US President Donald Trump suggested that American football should be renamed. Trump argued that the game played with a round ball — soccer — is the sport that truly deserves the name "football" FIFA President Gianni Infantino reminded the US audience that the 2026 World Cup would be the equivalent of "104 Super Bowls"

will open their title defense against Algeria, with further group-stage fixtures against Austria and tournament debutants Jordan in Group J.Spain, among the leading contenders and current European champions, will begin their campaign against first-time qualifiers Cape Verde before facing Uruguay and Saudi Arabia in Group H."All the praise will not weaken us, quite the opposite," insisted Spain coach Luis de la Fuente."We want to do something big at this World Cup and that means making sure we do well in the group stage, then carrying on from there."Thomas Tuchel's England, seeking to win the World Cup for the first time since 1966, will hope to win Group L that features beaten 2018 finalists Croatia as well as Ghana and Panama.Two-time winners France, meanwhile, face awkward tests against Senegal and Erling Haaland's Norway in Group I, which will be completed by an intercontinental play-off winner from either Iraq, Bolivia or Suriname.For the first time, the draw was done in such a way as to ensure the four highest-ranked nations were kept apart -- Spain, Argentina, France and England cannot meet before the semi-finals, if all four top their groups.However, the path to that stage -- with an extra knockout round now following the group phase -- looks perilous for some of the contenders.If the top seeds all finish first in their groups, England could, for example, find themselves playing co-hosts Mexico in Mexico City in the last 16 and then Brazil in the quarter-finals, before a last-four clash with Argentina.The tournament will be held across the United States, Mexico and Canada from June 11 to July 19, with 16 more teams added to the global showpiece, up from the 32 nations involved in 2022.That means a total of 104 matches, compared to 64 games last time.While the US will host the majority of matches including the final at the MetLife Stadium outside New York, three of the 16 venues will be in Mexico and two in Canada.The three hosts have experienced turbulent relations since Trump came to power but he brushed that aside."We've worked closely with those two countries, and the coordination and friendship and relationship has been outstanding," Trump said after receiving his peace prize from FIFA president Gianni Infantino."It is truly one of the great honors of my life. I think the players know better. Article Title: Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James shuts down heckler before torching Philadelphia 76ers in legendary comeback

As James stood near the premium seats, a person saw his chance and said,Clearly not ready for LBJ's response:"You still ain't got no hair though.”James, the first active NBA player to surpass a net worth of $1 billion, locked eyes with the man and shrugged, and said:"It happens. You know what I do got though! Got plenty of it!"The fans laughed their asses off as LeBron walked back up the floor with a smile on his face.LeBron James certainly doesn't have it every night as he approaches the age of 41. The Philadelphia 76ers learnt the hard way Sunday night.Two games after breaking a 1,297-game streak of double-digit scoring, James led the Lakers to a 112-108 road victory by scoring 10 consecutive points in the fourth quarter.His first bucket of the run increased the Lakers' advantage to 102-98. He then made a 22-foot jumper at 4:25, a three at 3:43, and another three at 1:12 to put the 76ers away.The final nail in the coffin came at the 27.4 mark, when he drained a stepback shot from the left wing to give the Lakers a 110-105 advantage, effectively ending the game for the home club.Also read: Could Zion Williamson actually surpass LeBron James, like an ex-teammate suggests?

Article Title: Chauncey Billups offloads $4.275M Oregon estate amid federal gambling probe
Article Text:
Portland Trail Blazers head coach Chauncey Billups gestures to his team during the second half against the Toronto Raptors at Scotiabank Arena (Image via John E. Sokolowski-Imagn Images)

Federal Probe Exposes High-Stakes Poker Scheme

Chauncey Billups Legal Fallout and Court Proceedings

Chauncey Billups Oregon Mansion Sold as Questions Mount

Chauncey Billups’ life off the court has taken a dramatic turn as the Portland Trail Blazers coach, long regarded as one of the NBA’s most respected figures, faces an escalating legal crisis tied to a mafia-linked illegal gambling operation. The story has gripped the league, stunned fans, and raised serious questions about Billups’ future both in Portland and in professional basketball.Amid the mounting scrutiny, Billups has made a major personal move: the sudden sale of his multimillion-dollar Oregon home. The timing of the transaction, finalized while federal charges advance, has only intensified speculation that financial and legal pressures may be reshaping his lifestyle behind the scenes.The scandal traces back to a sweeping federal investigation that uncovered a sophisticated, rigged poker network operating across major U.S. cities including Manhattan, Las Vegas, Miami, and the Hamptons. Billups is accused of participating as a celebrity draw, enticing wealthy players, referred to as “fish”, into games designed to deceive participants through altered shuffling machines, concealed cameras, X-ray table setups, and marked cards.Authorities estimate that victims were defrauded out of roughly $7 million beginning in 2019.The illegal enterprise allegedly involved members of the Gambino, Genovese, and Bonanno crime families, who enforced debt collection through intimidation, threats, and physical assaults. Investigators say Billups received payouts for his role, including a notable $50,000 wire transfer following a game in 2020. The probe also snared other basketball figures such as former NBA player Damon “DJ” Jones and Miami Heat guard Terry Rozier, who were pulled into overlapping gambling and insider-betting activities focused on injuries.Chauncey Billups’ arrest in Portland in late October 2025 triggered his immediate placement on unpaid and indefinite leave by the Trail Blazers. Officials emphasized that the allegations are unrelated to his coaching responsibilities, but the fallout has nonetheless disrupted the franchise. Billups entered a not-guilty plea in federal court on November 24, 2025, and was released on a $5 million bond backed by family properties in Colorado. He is barred from all gambling activity as part of his release terms, with his next court hearing scheduled for March 4, 2026.Just as the scandal intensified, Chauncey Billups moved to offload his 7,366-square-foot Lake Oswego estate, a property he purchased in July 2021 for $3.9 million through his LLC, “Phavored.” Complete with luxurious amenities including a lagoon-style pool and a multi-level spa waterfall, the home initially listed in the $3-4 million range but ultimately secured a sale price of $4.275 million. The profitable sale has triggered debate over whether he is securing legal funds, preparing for a potential move back to his Denver roots, or simply capitalizing on market conditions.Also read: "By an AI snow bunny?" - Gilbert Arenas roasts Matt Barnes over $61k AI extortion fiasco With the Trail Blazers sitting at 9–15 under interim coach Tiago Splitter and clinging to early playoff hopes, Billups’ uncertain future looms over the organization. Once celebrated for his five All-Star selections and 2004 NBA Finals MVP run, he now faces a battle that stretches far beyond basketball, leaving fans to wonder whether “Mr. Big Shot” can recover from the most perilous challenge of his career.
Article Summary: Chauncey Billups is the head coach of the Portland Trail Blazers of the NBA. He is accused of taking part in a high-stakes poker scheme linked to the Gambino, Genovese, and Bonanno crime families. Billups entered a not-guilty plea in federal court on November 24, 2025, and was released on a $5 million bond backed by family properties.
